intro: Teucrium petiolare var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent germander, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with a pubescent (hairy) surface. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually violet or blue in color, arranged in whorled clusters. It is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands.
